intro: Ouratea guaiquinimensis, commonly known as the Guaiquinimenses Ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in humid, shaded environments with rich, well-drained soil. Its botanical features include small, clustered fruits that develop from its hermaphroditic flowers. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
